byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from New Delhi, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan. Mujib Mashal contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and SALMAN MASOOD

abstract: Indian Prime Min Narendra Modi arrives in Lahore, Pakistan, for impromptu visit with Prime Min Nawaz Sharif; is first time Indian premier has visited Pakistan in almost 12 years, and signals that Modi's administration will seek to engage with Pakistan rather than follow policy of confrontation.
lead_paragraph: The Indian prime minister Narendra Modi met with Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif amid tentative steps by both nations to improve their historically tense relations.

headline.main: Narendra Modi of India Meets Pakistani Premier in Surprise Visit
headline.print_headline: Indian Premier Goes to Pakistan in Diplomatic Act

snippet: The Indian prime minister Narendra Modi met with Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif amid tentative steps by both nations to improve their historically tense relations.
